Compass by Margaritaville Breaks Ground in Flagler Beach - Daytona State In Motion Skip to content Menu News Features Arts & Entertainment Sports Opinion About 5th Quarter Aeolus Magazine Menu Home » News » Compass by Margaritaville Breaks Ground in Flagler Beach Compass by Margaritaville Breaks Ground in Flagler Beach Posted on February 25, 2024 February 25, 2024 by Landen Looker A photo of the Flagler Beach Hotel, fronting Verteran’s Park in 1964. Photo credit: Flagler County Historical Society . Flagler Beach’s Compass by Margaritaville hotel has broken ground. Located in the center of Flagler Beach, Veteran’s Park, it has stirred the attention of many locals. Ormond Beach-based Elite Hospitality’s developer and manager, Manoj Bhoola, alongside Jeremy Bain from Welbro Building Corp., are leading the charge on the project set to reshape Flagler Beach. Addressing an eager crowd of over 80 locals at City Hall, they unveiled plans for what promises to be the most significant construction endeavor in the area. From 1925 to 1972, Flagler Beach proudly hosted the renowned Flagler Beach Hotel. Built by Dana Fellows Fuquay and George Moody, it quickly became a beloved destination for leisure. “Due to structural issues in the 70’s it (the hotel) was demolished”, says Caryn Miller, director of Flagler Beach’s CRA. This left a void in the community’s once booming hospitality. But now, with the construction of the Compass by Margaritaville, a new era of vitality could be on the horizon, certainly bringing change to the community. Construction progress on the Compass by Margaritaville as of February 20, 2024. Photo by Landen Looker. “The CRA (Community Redevelopment Area) functions based on its master plan, and the master plan called for looking for a hotel for that sight, and that’s exactly what happened” adds Caryn Miller. Miller attended that meeting at City Hall where the plans were unveiled. That said, there are still many mom-and-pop hotels and motels along the Flagler Beach coast with incredible charm. Those include the Si Como No Inn , the Topaz Motel , the Beachfront Motel and more. Contrasting those mom-and-pop accommodations, this ambitious venture will sprawl across 84,000 square feet over three stories, boasting 100 rooms, a large restaurant, a fitness center, and a pool deck complete with a tiki bar. Guests will also have access to a rooftop terrace and exclusive retail outlets. It is expected to begin operating in Spring of 2025. Managed by Elite Hospitality, the restaurant alone is poised to create around 60 job opportunities, while the hotel itself will offer nearly 25 coveted positions. As construction gears up, expect to see bustling activity primarily from Monday to Friday, with the possibility of Saturday shifts in case of weather-induced setbacks. Inevitably, progress comes with a few adjustments. South Central Avenue, spanning from SR 100 to South 2nd Street, will be temporarily closed to vehicular traffic, ensuring smooth operations for the project. Additionally, parking and sidewalk access along South Second Street will be suspended to accommodate construction needs. Concerns have emerged surrounding the parking arrangements and construction plans for the Compass by Margaritaville development. Residents argue that these initiatives could potentially disrupt the authentic local ambiance of the community. Given its relatively diminutive size, such large-scale construction projects are unprecedented for many residents. However, some may argue that these concerns must be balanced against the overarching objective of uplifting the Flagler Beach economy. Whispers of excitement and apprehension alike dance through the air, as locals and visitors engage in spirited conversation about the Compass by Margaritaville. For some, it represents a wave of progress, promising new opportunities and revitalization for the beloved coastal town. For others, it sparks concerns of overdevelopment and the erosion of Flagler Beach’s unique charm. 1 thought on “ Compass by Margaritaville Breaks Ground in Flagler Beach ” Judy McDonough says: March 11, 2024 at 6:37 pm When will it be finished? ESCAPE THE CROWD, WORK IN STYLE Chill Inn CoWorking Space Chaweng Noi | Koh Samui Ditch the distractions and work in style Chill Inn CoWorking is your one-stop shop for productivity in paradise. Stuck between the party vibes of Chaweng and the laid-back charm of Lamai?  Chill Inn CoWorking offers the perfect middle ground.  This brand new co-working space Chill Inn puts you right in the heart of the action, but with a focus on productivity and peace of mind. Fuel Your Creativity At our café, we believe great work starts with great food. Whether you're here for a quick bite between meetings or to savor a slow, nourishing meal while brainstorming, our menu is designed to fuel your mind and body. Enjoy fresh, locally sourced ingredients that showcase the best of Koh Samui's flavors—crafted with care to keep you energized and inspired throughout the day. Learn More Experience the Chill Inn Difference Drawing on the success of our popular hostels around Koh Samui, Chill Inn CoWorking brings the same commitment to comfort and community.  This isn't just a co-working space – it's a chance to connect with other remote workers, share ideas, and create a network that extends beyond your screen. Co-working Desks Fast Internet Cafe & Bar Meeting Rooms Dedicated Desks Best Location Collaboration Area Shower Facilities Become a member We’ve built the best co-working space Koh Samui has ever seen. Sign up today or drop by to come and see the space. Learn More The Spaces The Ideal Location Ditch the long commutes - Chill Inn CoWorking sits conveniently between Koh Samui's two most popular beaches, allowing you to seamlessly blend work and play.  Need a post-work refresh? Lamai's stunning sunsets and relaxed atmosphere await. Craving a bit more energy? Chaweng's vibrant nightlife is just a stone's throw away. Fuel Your Focus No co-working space is complete without exceptional food and drinks.  Chill Inn CoWorking boasts a highly-rated cafe and bar serving up delicious pastries and barista-crafted coffees to keep you energized throughout your workday.  Unwind after a productive session with a refreshing drink, all without ever leaving the building. Your Workspace, Your Way Whether you thrive in a collaborative environment or prefer a quiet corner to focus, Chill Inn CoWorking caters to every work style -  Choose from a variety of seating options, from private desks, comfy beanbags to communal tables, to find your productivity zone.  Need to print a document or two?  They've got you covered with a reliable printer.  And of course, you can stay connected with blazing-fast wifi to ensure seamless online collaboration. Parramore Ave. has b en condemned 4 hours ago 8 residents displaced after historic Parramore building condemned Read full article: 8 residents displaced after historic Parramore building condemned Orlando city leaders break ground on repairs and upgrades to Orlando’s Albert Park 6 hours ago Officials break ground on upgrades to Orlando’s Albert Park; set to reopen end of year Read full article: Officials break ground on upgrades to Orlando’s Albert Park; set to reopen end of year Sign up for our events newsletter: Sign Up Local News Flagler Beach art gallery owner to open café, bar & grill 3-story venue to serve breakfast, lunch and dinner with a view Patricia Tolley , Content Gatherer Published: December 9, 2023 at 10:00 AM Updated: December 9, 2023 at 10:13 AM Tags: Flagler Beach , Flagler County , Florida Foodie , Food Chef MJ Smith (left) and a hashbrown bowl (right) (Copyright 2023 by WKMG ClickOrlando - All rights reserved.) FLAGLER BEACH, Fla. – Marge and Ted Barnhill are in their 70s and rather than relaxing beachside enjoying retirement, they are getting ready to open a restaurant. This new eatery is Barnhill’s Café, Bar & Grill, which opens mid-January and will be located at 202 S. Central Avenue in Flagler Beach, according to front-of-house manager Tara Palazzotto. Recommended Videos Marge and Ted Barnhill are husband and wife, with Marge owning the Gallery of Local Art next door to the new café. However, Marge always had a dream of operating a restaurant and Ted finally agreed to expand their investment in the city, Palazzotto said. [EXCLUSIVE: Become a News 6 Insider (it’s FREE) | PINIT! Share your photos ] Barnhill’s Café, Bar & Grill will be a three-story venue, serving breakfast, lunch and dinner with a view of the beach. It is working on hiring 20-30 employees at this time. MJ Smith is the executive chef creating the vast menu for the eatery. Right now, the test kitchen is underway, with Smith and his team working to nail down the exact dishes that will be served, according to the restaurant’s Facebook page . Meanwhile, one item Smith confirmed will be available at Barnhill’s is its breakfast crispy hash brown bowls, which he thinks will be a huge seller. These bowls will come in a variety of styles with different toppings such as eggs, cheese and bacon. Overall, to monitor when the restaurant posts its official grand opening date and hours of operations click here. Check out the Florida Foodie podcast. You can find every episode in the media player below: Copyright 2023 by WKMG ClickOrlando - All rights reserved.
